product.name: 12 Rules for Life: An Antidote to Chaos
product.description: The #1 Sunday Times and International Bestseller from 'the most influential ublic intellectual in the Western world right now' (New York Times) What are the most valuable things that everyone should know? Acclaimed clinical sychologist Jordan Peterson has influenced the modern understanding of ersonality, and now he has become one of the world's most oular ublic thinkers, with his lectures on toics from the Bible to romantic relationshis to mythology drawing tens of millions of viewers. In an era of unrecedented change and olarizing olitics, his frank and refreshing message about the value of inidual resonsibility and ancient wisdom has resonated around the world. In this book, he rovides twelve rofound and ractical rinciles for how to live a meaningful life, from setting your house in order before criticising others to comaring yourself to who you were yesterday, not someone else today. Hainess is a ointless goal, he shows us. Instead we must search for meaning, not for its own sake, but as a defence against the suffering that is intrinsic to our existence. Drawing on vivid examles from the author's clinical ractice and ersonal life, cutting edge sychology and hilosohy, and lessons from humanity's oldest myths and stories, 12 Rules for Life offers a deely rewarding antidote to the chaos in our lives: eternal truths alied to our modern roblems.

product.name: Born Survivors: Three Young Mothers and Their Extraordinary Story of Courage, Defiance, and Hope
product.description: The Nazis murdered their husbands but concentration cam risoners Priska, Rachel, and Anka would not let evil take their unborn children too#8212;a remarkable true story that will aeal to readers of emThe Lostem and emThe Nazi Officer#8217;s Wife, Born Survivorsem celebrates three mothers who defied death to give their children life.Eastern Euroe, 1944: Three women believe they are regnant, but are torn from their husbands before they can be certain. Rachel is sent to Auschwitz, unaware that her husband has been shot. Priska and her husband travel there together, but are immediately searated. Also at Auschwitz, Anka hoes in vain to be reunited with her husband. With the rest of their families gassed, these young wives are determined to hold on to all they have left#8212;their lives, and those of their unborn babies. Having concealed their condition from infamous Nazi doctor Josef Mengele, they are forced to work and almost starved to death, living in daily fear of their regnancies being detected by the SS.In Aril 1945, as the Allies close in, Priska gives birth. She and her baby, along with Anka, Rachel, and the remaining inmates, are sent to Mauthausen concentration cam on a hellish seventeen-day train journey. Rachel gives birth on the train, and Anka at the cam gates. All believe they will die, but then a miracle occurs. The gas chamber runs out of Zyklon-B, and as the Allied troos near, the SS flee. Against all odds, the three mothers and their newborns survive their treacherous journey to freedom.On the seventieth anniversary of Mauthausen#8217;s liberation from the Nazis by American soldiers, renowned biograher Wendy Holden recounts this extraordinary story of three children united by their mothers#8217; unbelievable#8212;yet ultimately successful#8212;fight for survival.

product.name: The Hideaway
product.description: style="text-align: center;"strongNow a emUSA Todayem and Amazon Charts Bestseller!strong style="text-align: center;"strongldquo;A story both owerful and enchanting: a donrsquo;t-miss novel in the greatest southern traditions of storytelling.rdquo; mdash;Patti Callahan Henry, emNew York Timesem bestselling authorstrongstrongWhen her grandmotherrsquo;s will wrenches Sara back home, she learns more about Margaret Van Buren in the wake of her death than she ever knew in life.strongAfter her last remaining family member dies, Sara Jenkins goes home to The Hideaway, her grandmother Magsrsquo;s ramshackle Bam;B in Sweet Bay, Alabama. She intends to quickly tie u loose ends then return to her busy life and thriving antique sho in New Orleans. Instead, she learns Mags has willed The Hideaway to her and charged her with renovating itmdash;no small task considering her grandmotherrsquo;s best friends, a motley crew of senior citizens, still live there.Rather than hurrying back to New Orleans, Sara stays in Sweet Bay and begins the biggest house-rehabbing roject of her career. Amid drywall dust, old memories, and a charming contractor, she discovers that sliing back into life at The Hideaway is easier than she exected.Then she discovers a box Mags left in the attic with clues to a life Sara never imagined for her grandmother. With hel from Magsrsquo;s friends, Sara begins to iece together the mysterious life of bravery, assion, and choices that changed her grandmotherrsquo;s destiny in both marvelous and devastating ways.When an oortunistic land develoer threatens to seize The Hideaway, Sara is forced to make a choicemdash;stay in Sweet Bay and fight for the house and the eole shersquo;s grown to love or leave again and return to her successful but solitary life in New Orleans.ldquo;Two endearing heroines and their oignant storylines of love lost and found make this the erfect book for an afternoon on the back orch with a glass of sweet tea.rdquo; mdash;strongKaren Whitestrong, emNew York Timesem bestselling author

product.name: Hard Road: A Jon Reznick Thriller, Book 1
product.description: Jon Reznick is a "ghost": a black-os secialist who takes his orders from shadowy handlers, and his salary from the US government. Still mourning the loss of his beloved wife on 911, he's disatched to carry out a high-level hit. Reznick knows only that it must look like suicide. It's textbook.

product.name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
product.description: Harry Potter has no idea how famous he is. That's because he's being raised by his miserable aunt and uncle who are terrified Harry will learn that he's really a wizard, just as his arents were. But everything changes when Harry is summoned to attend an infamous school for wizards, and he begins to discover some clues about his illustrious birthright. From the surrising way he is greeted by a lovable giant, to the unique curriculum and colorful faculty at his unusual school, Harry finds himself drawn dee inside a mystical world he never knew existed and closer to his own noble destiny.
